org.apache.hama.bsp.message

Interface MessageManager<M extends org.apache.hadoop.io.Writable>

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractMessageManager, HamaAsyncMessageManagerImpl, HamaMessageManagerImpl, LocalBSPRunner.LocalMessageManager

    public interface MessageManager<M extends org.apache.hadoop.io.Writable>
    This manager takes care of the messaging. It is responsible to launch a server if needed and deal with incoming data.

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description

      Gets the number of messages in the current queue.

      Send the message bundle to self to receive in the next superstep.

      Register a listener for the events in message manager.

      This is the real transferring to a host with a bundle.

    • Method Detail

      • init

        void init(TaskAttemptID attemptId,
        BSPPeer<?,?,?,?,M> peer,
        HamaConfiguration conf,
        InetSocketAddress peerAddress)
        Init can be used to start servers and initialize internal state. If you are implementing a subclass, please call the super version of this method. The socket address provided may be used for initializing the server connection. If it is used or not used, the message manager should provide a unique InetSocketAddress that identifies the server for the peer listening on the socket. This socket address should be returned in getListenerAddress()

      • close

        void close()
        Close is called after a task ran. Should be used to cleanup things e.G. stop a server.

      • getCurrentMessage

                                                          throws IOException

        This is the real transferring to a host with a bundle.

      • clearOutgoingMessages

        void clearOutgoingMessages()
        Clears the outgoing queue. Can be used to switch queues.

      • getNumCurrentMessages

        int getNumCurrentMessages()
        Gets the number of messages in the current queue.

      • registerListener

        void registerListener(MessageEventListener<M> listener)
                      throws IOException
        Register a listener for the events in message manager.
        Parameters:
        listener - MessageEventListener object that processes the messages sent to remote peer.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • getListenerAddress

        InetSocketAddress getListenerAddress()
        Returns the server address on which the incoming connections are listening on.
